properties.title: NoodleMania goes to Flour + Water
properties.desc: Everything went as others told me it would, and I mean everything.
properties.byline: by Annika Hom and Mark Rabine

properties.title: NoodleMania goes to Mau
properties.desc: The noodles practically jumped onto my fork and clung to it, not in a mass, but each with an irrepressible desire to be lifted clean up to my mouth and taken in.
properties.byline: by Annika Hom and Mark Rabine

properties.title: NoodleMania goes to Ushio
properties.desc: I wish you had warned me not to eat ramen while watching the NBA finals unless wearing a bib or hazmat suit.
properties.byline: by Annika Hom and Mark Rabine

properties.title: NoodleMania goes to bon, nene
properties.desc: I took one bite, and bam! Cue the wave of an unfamiliar flavor and the ensuing child-like wonder. I got major Willy Wonka and his fictitious Three Course Dinner chewing gum vibes.
properties.byline: by Annika Hom and Mark Rabine

properties.title: Noodlemania goes to Burma Love
properties.desc: It was love at first bite. I immediately tasted the potent coconut curry. My tongue tingled upon the spicy sensation.
properties.byline: by Annika Hom and Mark Rabine

properties.title: NoodleMania goes to Yamo
properties.desc: When you think Yamo, you think cheap, right? One of the last holes-in-the-wall where you don’t have to pay double for the downbeat décor. But Yamo has a rep beyond its bottom line.
properties.byline: by Annika Hom and Mark Rabine
